Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>、いつも大切そうにしてるね、 そのカード。
Entry.EnglishText: You seem to always be taking good care of those cards, <Hilda>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 折れたり、汚れたりしたら、 正確に占う事ができなくなるもの。
Entry.EnglishText: If they become creased or dirty, then you aren't able to accurately tell fortunes.
Entry.Notes: You're seem to always be taking good care of those cards, <HIlda>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 汚れたり折れたりしてるカードが混じってたら、 それが相手の注意を引いちゃうでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: Should there be creased or dirty cards in the mix, don't you think that the other person would pay attention to that?

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか……ちゃんと、 お手入れしてあげてるんだネ。
Entry.EnglishText: I see... So you've gotta keep your cards in order.
